rules: Rule1: Provided that the exhibition includes furniture, the exhibition opening is successful.
Rule2: Under the condition that the education team has selected a game, then if the curator has rejected the publication, it follows that the opening of the exhibition is not delayed.
Rule3: Either the education team has selected a game or the education team has rejected a game.
Rule4: Whenever the education team has rejected a game, then should the curator reject the publication, the exhibition opening will not be delayed.
Rule5: Provided that the curator has approved the artwork, the technicians have installed the artwork.
Rule6: Whenever the exhibition includes a vehicle, the exhibition opening is successful.

Rule7: Provided that the manager has confirmed the venue, then if it is not the case that having the guide schedule a tour implies (upon the director denying funding that the curator has not exceeded the budget), the guide has not rescheduled a tour.
Rule8: Either the manager has confirmed the venue or the manager has rejected the venue.

Rule9: In the case that the manager has rejected the venue, then should it not be true that the guide scheduling a tour leads to (if the director denies funding, then the curator has not exceeded the budget), the guide does not reschedule a tour.
Rule10: If the director has approved funding, then the curator has not exceeded the budget.
Rule11: The director has approved funding or the director has denied funding.
Rule12: Under the condition that the curator has requested an extension, then if the director has denied funding, it follows that the curator has not exceeded the budget.
Rule13: Either the curator has requested an extension or the director has granted an extension.
Rule14: If the director has granted an extension, then the curator has approved the artwork.
Rule15: Provided that the curator has approved the publication, the opening of the exhibition is not delayed.
Rule16: Either the curator has approved the publication or the curator has rejected the publication.
Rule17: If it is not the case that either the exhibition includes furniture or the exhibition includes a vehicle, then the curator has exceeded the budget.
Rule18: If it is not the case that the guide scheduling a tour leads to (upon the director denying funding that the curator has not exceeded the budget), then the guide has rescheduled a tour.

Rule19: Under the condition that it is not the case that the director granting an extension implies (if the director denies funding, then the curator has not exceeded the budget), the opening of the exhibition is delayed.

Rule20: Provided that it is not true that (it not being the case that (the technicians installing the artwork not implying (if the director denies funding, then the curator has not exceeded the budget)) results in the director cancelling the exhibition) entails the director hiring a consultant, then the curator has extended the deadline.

Rule21: Under the condition that it is not the case that (it not being true that (not having the technicians install the artwork lead to (if the director denies funding, then the curator has not exceeded the budget)) implies the director cancelling the exhibition) leads to the director hiring a consultant, then it is not the case that the curator has extended the deadline.
facts: Fact1: The guide has scheduled a tour.
Fact2: It is not the case that the director has cancelled the exhibition.
Fact3: The director has not hired a consultant.
